bestBHT.bht: The radical character of the division brought by the Gospel affects domestic relations, as family ties cannot stand in the way of loyalty to Christ. The Gospel's impact on households can cause variance between fathers and sons, and daughters-in-law and mothers-in-law. By emphasizing the disruption of domestic peace, the verse reveals the tension between familial relationships and the call to follow Christ. This division is a tragic consequence when parents stand in the way of their children's relationship with Christ.

bhtAttempts.bht: The radical and bitter division brought about by the Gospel is captured in Matthew 10:35. Family and social ties are unable to hinder loyalty to Christ and righteous living. The verse speaks to the tragedy of a parent coming between their child and Christ. Even newly-married couples may be set at variance due to their commitment to Christ. This disruption of domestic peace illustrates the profound impact of peace with God through Christ. Ultimately, the verse highlights the uneasy intersection of familial relationships and the call to follow Christ.

The Gospel's radical impact is seen in the bitter divisions it brings, even within families. Loyalty to Christ and righteous living take precedence over family and societal ties. This disruption of domestic peace underscores the profound impact of finding peace with God through Christ. The verse reveals the tension between familial relationships and the call to follow Christ, where even newly-married couples may find themselves at variance due to their commitment to Him.
